text: Hi there, I am trying to use the watch command in my local environment but somehow it says that it doesn’t watch the watched directory when started
But when I use hs upload it works just fine
Hope anybody can help me?
it is saying that it doesnt automaticly upload all files when started now., that was somthing it used to do
if you make a file chaneg in that directory it will upload the file as you make the change
Yes, I would like to change it automatically in my design manager but at this moment it seems like that I need to do this manually or not?
instead of watch you should use `upload` first
the watch the files
You can also pass in the `-i` flag to have the watch command do the initial upload
this is true
The watch command uploads the files to your design manager, it doesn’t publish them.  That is still up to you
npx hs -i watch /Users/kevinbergmeijer/Desktop/Ubiqum_pricing/pricing-template /pricing-template
so, if I type this then from that moment it watches all the files
At the moment as mentioned only it works with the hs upload (to get it displayed in my design manager)
it wil watch the entire theme folder if that is where you are when calling hs watch

`npx hs watch -i /Users/kevinbergmeijer/Desktop/Ubiqum_pricing/pricing-template /pricing-template`  would be what you want. The `-i` flag is an option on the `watch` command, not the `hs` command.

What that is saying is it will watch that first directory you passed in for changes, and when it detects them, it will upload those changed files to design-manager under the `/pricing-template` path.
[ERROR] Unknown arguments: i,
hs watch -i
Thanks, I think it will work now
Yes it works :+1:
for future reference <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#commands>

I’ve got an `.hsignore` file with `theme.json` in it, but HubSpot still keeps overwriting it with changes when I fetch, but it’s properly ignoring with `hs watch`. Does it not work with `hs fetch --overwrite`?
The command was specifically intended for use when uploading or watching content using the CLI.
